tool.name: Univariate Analysis
tool.description: Applies either a t-test (two-tailed) or anova (1-way) depending on the number of classes present
tool.command:
#set $tool_directory = $getVar('__tool_directory__', '../../../../tools/Statistics') #if str($executable.value) == "true" sh $tool_directory/bin/run_Univariate.sh /usr/local/MATLAB/MATLAB_Compiler_Runtime/v83 '${pls_dso}' '${fdr}' '${controlclass}' '${output_results}' '${parametric}' #else matlab -logfile ${output_log} -nosplash -r "cd('$tool_directory/source'); Univariate('${pls_dso}', '${fdr}', '${controlclass}', '${output_results}', '${parametric}'); exit;"
#end if

param.name: fdr
param.label: False discovery rate.
param.help: The false discovery rate you wish to apply e.g. 0.05, 0.1. Benjamini-Hochberg correction is applied at a false discovery rate set by the user

param.name: controlclass
param.label: The name of the class to be used as control group (for fold change). e.g. controlclass = 'control';

param.name: parametric
param.label: Type of test
param.option: Non-parametric (Wilcoxon rank sum or Kruskalâ€“Wallis test)
